security_audit.summary: The static analyzer flagged 248 issues, but all are false positives. Markdown documentation backticks were misidentified as shell command execution. The Python script is a straightforward bioRxiv API client that makes legitimate requests to https://api.biorxiv.org, saves results to files, and optionally supports API key authentication. No malicious intent, data exfiltration, or suspicious behavior patterns found.

content.user_title: Search bioRxiv preprints by keywords, authors, and dates
content.value_statement: Researchers waste hours manually searching bioRxiv for relevant preprints. This skill automates literature discovery with precise filtering by keywords, authors, date ranges, and scientific categories.
actual_capabilities: Search bioRxiv preprints by keywords in titles and abstracts
Filter results by 27 scientific categories including neuroscience, genomics, and bioinformatics
Download full-text PDFs of any preprint using DOI
Retrieve papers by specific authors within date ranges
Export structured JSON metadata with abstracts, DOIs, and citation info
limitations: Limited to bioRxiv preprints only (no medRxiv or other servers)
Rate limited to 0.5 seconds between API requests
Maximum 100 papers returned per search query
Requires internet connection to access bioRxiv API

output_examples.input: Search for COVID-19 vaccine papers from 2021
output: Top result: 'mRNA vaccine efficacy against variants' by Smith et al.

output_examples.input: Find neuroscience papers by author 'Yong' from 2024
output: Recent: 'Neural circuit mapping in vivo' by Yong et al.

best_practices: Use category filters to narrow results and improve search precision
Implement caching to avoid repeated API calls for the same queries
Respect rate limits by adding delays between bulk operations
anti_patterns: Avoid searching without date ranges - this returns excessive results
Do not make concurrent requests - this violates bioRxiv's rate limits
Never hardcode DOIs in scripts - always use search results dynamically

faq.question: Does this search medRxiv preprints too?
faq.answer: No, this skill only searches bioRxiv for life sciences preprints. MedRxiv requires separate API access.

faq.question: How many papers can I download at once?
faq.answer: The API returns up to 100 papers per search. Download PDFs one at a time with 0.5s delays between requests.

faq.question: Can I search full text content?
faq.answer: Searches only scan titles, abstracts, and author names. Full-text search requires downloading PDFs separately.

faq.question: What date formats are accepted?
faq.answer: Use YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., 2024-01-15). You can also use --days-back for relative dates.

faq.question: Are published papers included?
faq.answer: Results include all bioRxiv preprints regardless of publication status. Check the 'published' field for journal information.

faq.question: How do I cite papers found through this tool?
faq.answer: Each result includes DOI, authors, title, and date. Use the DOI to generate proper citations in your reference manager.
